clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Liquorice on Salivary Cortisol and Cortisone

brief_summary.textblock: Salivary cortisol is used as a diagnostic analysis in the investigation of suspected Cushings' syndrome. This study evaluates if liqourice intake increases salivary cortisol in healthy individuals. Late night salivary cortisol and cortisone is analysed before, during and after 7 days of liqourice intake in three different doses.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Each group of 10 individuals uses liqourice for 7 days and late night salivary cortisol and cortisone is analysed before (baseline), during and after (washout) intake.

primary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to day 7 during liqourice intake
primary_outcome.description: Significantly increased salivary cortisol 23:00 PM compared to baseline (i.e. before start of liqourice intake).

primary_outcome.measure: Time to normalization of late night salivary cortisol
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1-28 days efter liqourice intake is stopped
primary_outcome.description: Time from liqourice intake is stopped until significant increase of late night salivary cortisol from baseline (i.e. assuming outcome 1 is significant increase) is no longer significant.

secondary_outcome.description: Significantly increased salivary cortisol 08:00 AM compared to baseline (i.e. before start of liqourice intake).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: day 1 to day 7 during liqourice intake
secondary_outcome.description: Significantly increased salivary cortisol 23:00 PM compared to baseline (i.e. before start of liqourice intake).

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to normalization of late night salivary cortisol/cortisone ratio
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1-28 days efter liqourice intake is stopped
secondary_outcome.description: Time from liqourice intake is stopped until significant increase of late night salivary cortisol from baseline (i.e. assuming outcome 1 is significant increase) is no longer significant.

arm_group.description: Liqourice corresponding to 1.5 mg glycyrrhizic acid per kg body weight is taken in the evening during 7 days.
Liqourice corresponding to 3.0 mg glycyrrhizic acid per kg body weight is taken in the evening during 7 days.
Liqourice corresponding to 6.0 mg glycyrrhizic acid per kg body weight is taken in the evening during 7 days.

intervention.description: Liqourice corresponding to 1.5, 3.0 or 6.0 mg glycyrrhizic acid per kg body weight is taken in the evening during 7 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women 18-65 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known pituitary or adrenal disease
- Medication with glucocorticoids (incl. inhalation, nasal, dermal)
- Known hypertension or blood pressure >140/90 at screening
- tobacco use
- Subjective problems in oral mucosa or saliva
- Abnormal diurnal rhythm (awake 03:00 - 05:30)
- Difficulties taking liqourice for 3 weeks or refraining from liqourice during 4 weeks
